722522f-a.title: Manhattan: Pearl Street - Park Row
722522f-a.text:
Pearl Street, at, adjoining and south of the S.W1. corner of Park Row,
as seen from Park Row with the Second and Third Aves., Elevated in the fore.
ground.
About 1914.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.
722522f-a.folder: Pearl Street & Park Row, Manhattan, NY

722454f-a.title: Manhattan: Park Row - Pearl Street
722454f-a.text:
116-120 Park Row, west side, between Pearl and Duane Streets.
April 21, 1917.
Underwood \& Underwoodg
NO PEPRODUCTIONS.
722454f-a.folder: Park Row & Pearl Street, Manhattan, NY

722457f-b.title: Manhattan: Park Row - Pearl Street
722457f-b.text:
Park Row, at, adjoining and south of the S.W. corner of Pearl
Street. Also shown is Pearl Street, south side, west from Park Row.
(Park Row is arbitrarily set to run north and south). (Pearl Street,
when west of Park Pow, proceeds east and west). The view shows the
Second and Third Ave., Elevated overhead on Park Row.
September 1, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
4. Park Row \& Pearl St., n.w. cor. Neg. A-11
P.L. Sperr, photographer  July 19, 1941
722457f-b.folder: Park Row & Pearl Street, Manhattan, NY

1508085-a.title: Pearl Street - Park Row - Cardinal Hayes Place
1508085-a.folder: Pearl Street - Park Row - Cardinal Hayes Place, Manhattan, NY

722519f-b.title: Manhattan: Pearl Street - Cardinal Place
722519f-b.text:
(1)
Pearl Street, west from Cardinal Plaoe, to, but not including Park
Street. The view shows the rear of the old Dept., of Health Buildint, at
the S.E. corner of Park Street.
September 30, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
The same, at a later date and showing the new Federal Courts Building
in the process of construction on the site of the former Board of Health
Building.
October 8, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
722519f-b.folder: Pearl Street & Cardinal Place, Manhattan, NY

722520f-a.title: Manhattan: Pearl Street - Park Row
722520f-a.text:
(1)
Pearl Street, west from but not including Park Row, to and in-
cluding Cardinal Place. The 3-story building (No. 466) adjoining
the N.W. corner of Park Row is a frame house.
March 27, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
The same, showing a closer view of No. 466.
1932.
J. Clarence Davies Collection, Museum of the City of New York.
Negative No. 6.
CREDIT LINE IMPERATIVE ON ALL REPRODUCTIONS.
(3)
Another view showing also the corner building at the Bowery.
October 7, 1930.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.
S, P3 Ncg.2E 326
BN
722520f-a.folder: Pearl Street & Park Row, Manhattan, NY
